Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in quiet street”
Reviews.Author: Tarada
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights with 2 girlfriends in a room with 2 full sized beds. It's not a big room (but from what I have read in other New York hotel reviews that's the standard in NYC - unless you are willing to pay double or more than the Carvi) but we were out most of the day and evenings and only used the room to sleep and showers, so it was okay. Be aware that each bed only have one cover, but housekeeping brought us an extra blanket so we didn't have to share covers. The room was cleaned every day and in good conditions. I especially liked the built in room for suitcases under the beds, otherwise the room would have been very crowded with 3 girlie suitcases ;) The bathroom had just enough space for each of our toiletries, but one more hanger on the door would be nice. The robes and thick white towels were a very pleasant treat and so is the free wi-fi. We enjoyed a nice breakfast every morning at the wonderful diner with the sweetest waitress just across the street, where you get a Carvi discount (ask for coupon in reception). Looking forward to returning to the Carvi next weekend, but are happy it's just the 2 of us this time - because the beds are a little narrow when it's not your sweetheart you're sharing the bed with :) We never used the free in-room coffee maker, so can't comment on that - but it's there :)

Reviews.Title: “I'll Take Manhattan...”
Reviews.Author: wildraisin
Reviews.Content: A Valetine's getaway to The Big Apple found us lodged in the Upper East Side Carvi Hotel. Easy to miss as the entrance looks like an office building and the rooms are incredibly small. BUT, with hotel rooms in NYC rented by the square inch, this place is a very good value. Roses on the bed, very clean, European looking, and of course very romantic. There's a good restaurant across the street for breakfast. Easy walking distance to Park Avenue, Central Park, etc. Parking is challenging and I recommend travel by train or taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: ClarkieG
Reviews.Content: I travel to NY frequently, in terms of location, convenience, price and room layout it works perfectly for me. Staff very friendly, hotel very clean, rooms compact by NY standards but they have everything you would need.

Reviews.Title: “Great and clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: DanishCritic
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Carvi Hotel for a week with my wife and teenage daughter. It was absolutely great. Nice atmosphere, friendly and helpfull staff. While somewhat small the rooms are well above NY stadard; very clean and the size of the rooms is no issue. Also a very nice and quiet street winthin walking distance of anything in midtown. Be aware of pricing. We found very good last minute deals on hotels.com.

Reviews.Title: “Good option in NY, clean, fair price.”
Reviews.Author: omoura
Reviews.Content: people in the front desk speak english ans portuguese. They are nice and helpful. Rooms are small, but clean and efficient. wifi and safe in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JPeek2011
Reviews.Content: The Carvi Hotel was a great choice for my first trip to New York City. It was very clean, nicely furnished, reasonably priced, and the staff were wonderful! It is within walking distance of many popular attractions and surrounded by good restaurants. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Way, Way Small - Be aware”
Reviews.Author: NoSleepSam
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nicely furnished, clean, and a very friendly staff. Problem is, the rooms are so small they are non-functional for more than one person. I was there for 4 days and I very nearly ate the room cost and moved hotels. One person no problem, two people and you are cooked. The shower is literally half sized. I'm 6"1' and dropped the soap and had to exit the shower to get enough room to bend down and pick up the soap. I saw at least 2 other new guests (both 2 people in 1 room) complaining and trying to get moved to larger rooms or completely different hotels. I know NYC hotels can be small, but when you book a room that information needs to be front and center.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room but maybe considered average by NYC standards?”
Reviews.Author: AmyLeeSydney
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was pretty good. Plenty of places to eat close by and a subway station within a couple of blocks. The room was tiny though and not comfortable for two people. I know rooms in NYC are small but this was uncomfortably small in my opinion. You could probably get away with it for one person but only for a few nights...just too cramped. The staff were friendly and helpful but I did feel like the towels never seemed fresh despite the fact that housekeeping came and changed then each day.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay at the Carvi”
Reviews.Author: JJVegTraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Carvi Hotel for four nights in early June 2011. We hadn’t been to NYC for 20 years and had no idea where to stay. As usual in this type of circumstance I turned to Trip Advisor. After much research we chose the Carvi due to the great reviews, good location, and reasonable rates (by NYC standards). When the cab dropped us off on East 55th Street, it took us a minute to find the hotel, as the front is very nondescript with the only sign being inconspicuous and on the awning overhead. At eye-level, the entranceway itself is totally blank with no signage and no décor of any kind (see photos). But the small lobby inside is nice, and all the people we met at the front desk were very friendly and helpful throughout our stay. We stayed on the fourth floor in a room facing the street. As others have noted, there are only 6 rooms per floor, and it appears that two of the rooms on each floor don’t have any windows, as they are interior rooms. I would not have been happy had we been given one of those rooms; I believe they are, however, lower in price. Our room had two big windows facing the street, not really a great view, however, as all we really could see well was the office building across the street. The room itself was very clean and modern, and while not large, was roomy enough for us. It was well planned and had plenty of space for all of our clothes and other items. Especially nice was having the use of the mini-fridge, which we emptied of hotel items and filled with our own groceries (from nearby ‘Klein’s’, a great grocery store about a 10-minute walk away). The bed was very comfortable, the sheets clean, and the shower was very powerful (although small in space). Everything in the room was super clean and fresh. There is a hair dryer, full-length mirror, safe, and free (fast) wifi in the room. But because it is a very small hotel, the hotel itself does not have many extras. For example, there is no restaurant or bar, and no fitness center. However, our main objective was to find a clean, modern hotel in a nice area with decent rates, and good, friendly service, and that’s what we found at the Carvi. The neighborhood around the hotel is nice. We always felt safe there, even walking back to the hotel very late at night. And there are many convenient shops within a small area including a Starbucks, a 24-hour drug store, and many small restaurants and cafes. We especially liked the Pig ‘n’ Whistle Pub around the corner on 3rd Avenue (they have an excellent house-made veggie burger). Our only suggestions would be the following. There was only one chair in the room. This meant that one of us had to sit on the bed to eat our breakfast. Although the room was small, there was enough space near the windows for a small table and another small chair. Also, it would have been nice if there were a few pictures on the walls. The TV reception was not great as the picture pixated quite a bit at times. Also, there was no way to have only one of the two bedside lights on – it was both lights on at once or nothing, which meant that I couldn’t read on my side of the bed (while my husband slept) without the light being on at his side of the bed. The other strange thing was the temperature control. Under the thermostat was an unfriendly sign saying that we were not to change the temperature, that if we wanted to change the temperature in the room we were to first call the front desk. We ended up changing it anyway, as we got cold during the night and the air conditioning was blowing right across the bed. Also, the a/c makes noise when it comes on and off during the night, and light sleepers might be bothered by this. Overall we found the hotel to be very quiet. However, on our last night (the only night we needed to get to sleep early) it appeared that the other rooms on our floor had been taken over by one family, who proceeded to leave their doors open and treat the whole floor as their own suite. They were quite noisy and we were about to call the front desk when they finally closed their doors sometime after 11:00pm. One thing we feel we should point out is the following. We noticed that there is a door outside the hotel entrance (i.e. essentially on the sidewalk) that leads directly up a flight of stairs with access into the hallways where the rooms are. This means that if that door is left ajar, anyone can access the hallways of the hotel without ever entering the lobby. The door is designed to lock after someone exits the hotel from this staircase, but it only does so if the person is careful to slam the door and make sure it is locked. On a few occasions we returned to the hotel to find this door ajar and unlocked. That being said, our complaints are minor and we do really like this hotel. We recommend it and plan to return again, as overall we had a very enjoyable experience at the Carvi.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for solo trips”
Reviews.Author: anastasia_loboda
Reviews.Content: Everyone knows how difficult it is to find a good and not ovepriced hotel in NY. For my first trip to New York in March,2011 Carvi hotel was the best possible choice. The rooms may not be very big, but they are very well equiped, clean and new. They Wi-Fi connection was stable and quick enough. The bed was sooo comfortable, that it was difficult to make myself wake up and explore this wonderful city. The front desk was very polite and helpful. You can here a lot noise from the street, but for me it wasn't that important - after a long day of walking through the city, nothing could disturb my dream.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: hdinwy
Reviews.Content: First night was put in a very small room that one could barely get around the bed. The walls were scuffed and needed paint, the carpet was stained, and the bathroom so small that if you dropped your soap in the shower you would have had to get out of the shower to pick it up. And the air conditioned was so loud that when it kicked on it would wake me up. However, the bed was comfortable. The next day I was moved to a larger room and that was better. When I asked about some consideration for the first night it was not granted but then it was not expected either. Overall, I was very diappointed because of that small room and will not be back.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Adriane_RBe
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my husband and my 3 year old daughter. It's a very new hotel, with friendly staff and well located. For brazilians it's very good, because there are a lot of brazilian employees there that can give us a lot of tips.

Reviews.Title: “Not likely that you get disappointed”
Reviews.Author: visitor1008
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a small, but very comfortable, clean and well equipped room. Great bed, soft linen and pillows. In the luxurious bathroom there's also a powerfull shower with hot water. There's a free wi-fi network within the hotel that worked very well. It's located in a pleasant neighborhood, almost in the corner of 55th St. and Lexington Av. Not so close to Times Square, and if you prefer not to walk by, the subway takes you there in a few minutes. The staff was also very helpful and likeable all the time. It was my second visit to NY. It's an astounding city and when you stay in a nice hotel like this it makes your trip even better. I really recommend this charming and efficient hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent small hotel in central New York”
Reviews.Author: eamonn_tgtv
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights at the Carvi on our first trip to New York. It is ideally located for sightseeing in Manhattan, within walking distance of Central Park, the Rockefeller Centre, and 5th Avenue. The rooms were modern and well equipped, with very comfortable beds. There is no restaurant,but the hotel has an arrangement with the little diner across the road which is open 24 hours, and good for breakfasts. The staff were friendly and helpful; one minor problem with a room was fixed within minutes. They booked us a car for our return trip to JFK airport, much better than a yellow cab, and hardly more expensive. Ideal for couples or families with teenagers looking for reasobly priced accommodation in central Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpectedly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: Gryffindorguy
Reviews.Content: This little hotel surpassed all my expectations. After spending three nights in a high end hotel in Times Square I was more than a little concerned with the quality of this hotel, especially after arriving to find its non-desrcript exterior and tiny lobby. The woman at the front desk who checked us in was very friendly and helpful (as was everyone else we came in contact with through the stay) and check in was a snap! I expected the room to be tiny because 1) this is NYC and 2) the hotel is so small. When we opened the door to the room I was shocked at the size, it is large compared to other hotels in the city (but keep in mind it is an average size room compared to hotels not in Manhattan). The bed was nice and firm but not to hard but the water pressure in the shower was incredible! Our room had a mildew smell but housekeeping took care of it and it was not an issue. The restaurant across the street acts as room service for this small hotel and guests of the Carvi get a 10% discount. The food is good and not over priced, we ended up eating there twice and both times enjoyed it. Overall, for what we paid for the room it was well worth it and I would stay there again. It may not be close to Times Square as other hotels but to not be in the hustle and bustle of the area is fine by me. One other note is that there is a subway entrance 2 blocks from the hotel that goes right to Times Square and to JFK, this makes it very easy to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in fab location”
Reviews.Author: K8schumi
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed in the Carvi in June 2010 for 3 nights. I was pleasantly surprised by the hotel. After reading reviews of so many NY rooms I was expecting it to be really small so was surprised at how spacious it was and it had a really comfortable bed. The hotel has free Wi-Fi as well as a computer available for guest use in the lobby and all the staff were really friendly. There isn’t an on-site restaurant which I would have liked, but you can order room service from a restaurant across the road. We actually ate out there on our first night and the food was fine. HUGE portions and the staff were very friendly. The best thing about this hotel I would say is the location. It is about a 10 minute walk from Grand Central Station or if that is too far for you there is a Metro station a block away. It was in walking distance to Times Square and Central Park. For fans of shopping Bloomingdales is only 4 blocks away. I would definitely recommend the Europa Cafe on 55th Street where we ate breakfast every morning. Just a short walk away but great food at great prices. Even the tea there was great which I did find a bit hit and miss in America! All in all Carvi is a great modern hotel in a fabulous location. If I am ever lucky enough to return New York I will certainly stay again at the Carvi Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Greath value for money”
Reviews.Author: DijanaZagreb
Reviews.Content: Very clean, so comfortable beds, few blocks away from famost 5th avenue, closed to lexington avenue subway station on 51/53 street, all rooms have showers - no bath tube, but only one on last 7th floor has it, room number 701 but that tube is so small that is not for relaxing tube after all day long exploring the city! There is no restaurant in hotel, only 10%discount on small restaurant cross the street where for is not any special, but is good enought to have a breakfast. Wifi signal is free, one computer in lobby of hotel that all guest can use. If you coming from EU dont have to bring your adapter for eletricity - they can give you one to use on recepton desk for free.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay. Perfect for business travelers or non-needy tourists”
Reviews.Author: crosenfe
Reviews.Content: I needed a place to stay while visiting family in the lower UES. Carvi won with a cheap rate and no bed bugs. I'm glad I stayed there. The beds were comfortable. The bathrooms were nice. When I fell ill, I found their cable to be extraordinary. Free wi-fi was an added bonus, and it was nice that the whole hotel is non-smoking. The front desk staff were helpful, but there's no concierge. If you need someone to plan your stay in NYC or get you in to a high-brow restaurant, Carvi is probably not the place for you. If you need a quiet, clean place to stay in Manhattan, Carvi is a good choice. That said, I've read prior tripadvisor reviews saying it's not worth the money. I got a great rate, right around $100 pre-tax. That was a steal. I don't think they're worth more than $250/night (hence I don't go to NYC in-season that often). The rooms are updated and efficient uses of space, but this is not a hotel that merits a trip. It's a hotel that nicely facilitates the NYC experience.

Reviews.Title: “Carvi-ed Out A Niche in New York”
Reviews.Author: Tellurian
Reviews.Content: Looking for a discreet, quiet location in mid-town, with stylish, comfortable rooms at an outstanding value? Check out and check in to the Carvi Hotel at 152 East 55th Street. On a recent solo business trip, the Carvi provided all the basics and luxuries that I needed to rest and work. I requested, and received, a room with a lot of natural light. Not everyone wants that “amenity” and not everyone who does would be comfortable to have the shared terrace directly in front of their 7th floor window. With use of curtains at appropriate times, worked for me, albeit it was a little off-putting to notice evidence that guests use the terrace (in this entirely non-smoking hotel) for smoking…. Overall the room is well-furnished and sharp. WiFi worked flawlessly, there was a nice Cuisinart coffee maker and a small fridge with items for sale as well as some room for one’s own supplies. The closet was substantial and included a laptop-sized safe. TV and clock-radio-ipod dock were up-to-date. The bathroom had killer-great water pressure and plenty of space and towel racks. There are a few “new hotel” quirks to be worked out with switches and lighting and finishing touches, like a mirror outside of the bathroom would be welcome. All in all I was very satisfied with what was promised matching what was delivered and the value received for the price paid in an excellent Manhattan location. I would be happy to return to the Carvi and to recommend it to like-minded friends and fellow travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: dan_wigan
Reviews.Content: On our most recent trip to NY we booked the Carvi hotel and were extremely pleased with everything about it. The location was just what we wanted, only 2 blocks from the nearest subway which made getting around very easy. The hotel is small by NY standards, probably about 25 rooms but the staff were very welcoming and friendly and answered any questions and told us the best places nearby to eat etc. The room although small was great for us on a 4 night stay. The bed was the most comfortable I have ever slept in which was a welcome sight at the end of a long day sightseeing. Room was very clean and modern, with flat screen TV, coffee maker, fridge/mini bar etc and a very powerful shower which was good. There is no restaraunt in the hotel but they do offer a 10% discount in a nearby place but we didnt eat there, I would certainly look to stop here again on future visits.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: jcmatos
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights, spacious (for NY standards) 7th floor room with direct view to balcony and outside (the window room is by the balcony, so someone there may view inside). The bed was very comfortable. The hotel is small (about 3 rooms per floor), well located, and the staff friendly. My only complaints were the noise coming from the corridor whenever someone was there (it´s a fairly tight corridor and the room door does not provide adequate sound-proof), which happened only seldom, and some of the bathroom towels needed to be better cleaned (stains not completly removed eventually because of defective washing). Altogether minor complaints, compared with the obvious advantages. It was a good staying and I will definetly recommend this hotel as a very good option for New York.

Reviews.Title: “New and clean.......”
Reviews.Author: waynelim
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at Hotel Carvi because it was a very clean and updated. I stayed for 8 days. The room had a very comfortable bed, appeared to be very new (carpet, paint, and furnishing) and had a excellent a/c and flat screen TV. The portable fridge and coffee maker were a nice touch. The washroom was good, marble and very up to date. The service at this hotel was excellent and the only things I can really complain about is that it lacks a gym and pool and the Wi-Fi is slow. The hotels location in upper Midtown worked perfectly for my stay. It was walking distance to alot of areas and was also very close to the Subway. If you stay at this hotel visit the Pax Cafe at the corner of the street and the Kirin Indian restaurant across the street, both of them are excellent value and quality eats.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Ayeletr
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel for a week and had a great time. The rooms are in good size, the shower is nice and very clean, the staff is wonderful and very helpfull. It would have been nicer to have more lights in the room - they only have one light and the room is kinda dark.

Reviews.Title: “Geat Choice!”
Reviews.Author: armandoleal
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, with a very good location. Close to everything, and not too noisy. Rooms are good, The bed is very confortable. And they give you free coffee :) The staff is just about the best!

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat location and price.”
Reviews.Author: Jadranko
Reviews.Content: 55th & Lex is a great location...only short walk to 5th Avenue stores and Bloomingdales. We used an Internet booking service and got a better price than what was offered on the hotel's website...under $160/night for a double. Our room was on the fourth floor facing 55th Street and amazingly quiet for central New York City. Slept through the night undisturbed. The Carvi is a small European hotel. Lobby is simple but the hotel staff is courteous, friendly, and helpful. They are a real asset to the hotel. There is a computer in the lobby available for guests to check their flights. Our room was a nice size, not a tight fit. The room was well equipped with hair dryer, iron and board, large flat screen TV, comfortable bed, frig and snacks, bathrobes, bathroom only with shower. Room service is provided by the diner across the street and hotel guests receive a 10% discount on orders in the diner. We had breakfast there and ordered sandwiches to go for our flight home. Everything was fine and reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Best bed I have ever slept in!”
Reviews.Author: crvmp7
Reviews.Content: I arrived in NY with my friend for a birthday party and we were unsure of what to expect from Carvi because it is so new. Needless to say the beds were unbelievable! I have never been in a bed more comfortable in my entire life. The rooms were very clean and tidy and the staff was very helpful. I would definitely recommend this to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: DriftRJ
Reviews.Content: Small, quiet and very comfortable hotel. Wonderful bed and shower. Great location!

Reviews.Title: “Can not recommend for the price.”
Reviews.Author: greggman
Reviews.Content: It's probably that I'm just not used to NYC prices but this is personally the most I've ever spent for a hotel room. With taxes and everything it was about $330 a night. For $330 a night I kind of expected a little better. The hotel is very small so no services. Of course I didn't need any but still, for $330 a night I guess I expected more. The room was the smallest I've been in outside of a Tokyo. The bed and room were fine and clean and the location as far as being convenient for exploring NYC was fine. Being my first time to NYC I didn't know where to stay although if I was to do it again I'd probably try to pick something near Soho or NYU in Greenwich Village. More stuff to do down there at night. The room we got was in the back facing another building. With the night shades open people can look directly in the room. There's some building air conditioner between the buildings that hums all night. I was able to sleep but I'd really prefer something more quiet, especially for the price. I guess ultimately I couldn't recommend it unless it was your one of your only options. Still, it was clean and the bed was comfortable which is sometimes enough.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel a real Gem in the middle of NewYork”
Reviews.Author: Gabriel999
Reviews.Content: What a great Hotel, new with great facilities including a fridge and safety deposit box. Immaculate room. Recommend to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay - clean, quiet, professional staff.”
Reviews.Author: ChgoGal11225
Reviews.Content: Got a great rate ($138) with Quikbook.com for the Carvi. The hotel is very convenient to a couple of subway lines, but a bit of a hike if you have B'way theater tickets. I spent lots of time in the East Village, West Village and lower Manhattan, and sometimes wished I were closer to the 2 or 3 lines which were more east - so I ended up having to transfer a lot. Not that big of a deal. The room itself was very comfortable - coffee maker in room, free HBO on a nice flat-screen TV, marble bathroom and shower. Quiet location - even with my room facing the street. Starbucks on the corner, and a CVS drugstore a block away. I'd stay again if the rates remain low - but I don't think that'll be the case.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean rooms and extremely nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Zef65
Reviews.Content: I was a bit dubious about staying at this hotel because nobody had heard of it! The reason for this, I found out, is that it just recently opened two months ago. I was traveling with my daughter (13 years) and my nephew (14) and we were in New York for a week. The room was very clean and for New York standards it was quite spacious. The bedding and linens are outstanding! I only stayed here for a night since we had already booked the rest of the trip in another hotel in Times Square, but I would happily return to this location instead. The manager, a very nice lady, came out one day to greet us and gave us a very warm welcome, she made us feel at home. Please consider this hotel on your next visit to NYC....you won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, Efficient Stay”
Reviews.Author: dimsum67
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a one night stay at the Carvi on 7/25,(reserved on Quickbook for $112.00 minus tax) The accomodations were fine, (spectacular for the price!) room was clean, ample space, marble bathroom, light wood furnishings, flat screen TV, feather pillows, soft towels, etc... There were no ammenities to speak of, but, plenty of food, drink, deli, spa options on the street. There appears to be 6 rooms per 8 floors, served by a single elevator. The lobby was small, staff were pleasant and competent. The place is somewhat non-descript, as it seemed to lack warmth or any memorable detail, but it was more than sufficient for a night's sleep. I would readily book the property for future visits if the price was right.
